cyclone.name: KAREN
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest Monday, then north Tuesday while tracking toward Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the U.S. Virgin Islands / Puerto Rico

weather_observation.under_watch: None (Tropical Storm Watch anticipated later today)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands are expected to be placed under a Tropical Storm Watch later today
weather_observation.warning_coast: Trinidad and Tobago, Grenada and its dependencies
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands, Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (34-kt) have a 38% cumulative probability and could arrive late Tuesday; low (6%) chance of reaching 50-kt strength.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; no surge guidance issued for the Virgin Islands at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated 5 inches possible Tuesday–Wednesday, leading to localized flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions beginning late Tuesday could disrupt port operations.
